## GAD-7 vs CRISIS

GAD-7 vs CRISIS: A Deep Dive Comparing psychological and health surveys can be a monumental task. Take for example 'GAD-7 vs CRISIS', two integral tools to gauge mental health in these trying times. The Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) functions as a measure of generalised anxiety disorder, whereas the CoRonavIruS Health Impact Survey (CRISIS) reflects the unique challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic. Attempting to harmonise or compare results from these questionnaires manually could often be time-consuming and potentially subjective. ## Harmony: A Solution This is exactly where Harmony steps in as the perfect solution for you. As a tool designed specifically to assist researchers in harmonising data from diverse instruments such as "GAD-7 vs CRISIS", Harmony can comparably save you an abundance of time. Leveraging cutting-edge AI models, it utilizes natural language processing to map and match questions even across multiple languages. It offers the option to select instruments from its database or to upload your custom tools directly. ## Why Use Harmony for GAD-7 vs CRISIS? Using Harmony for GAD-7 vs CRISIS comparison brings with it a plethora of advantages. Its comprehensive database can provide a percentage match between each item of the GAD-7 and CRISIS surveys. It also allows for effective longitudinal and cross-study comparisons at the convenience of a user-friendly interface. So, why choose the hard way when you have Harmony at your service to streamline the complex process of analyzing and comparing GAD-7 vs CRISIS.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
